tagDescription: Correspondence relating to the preparation of the Canadian care before the Alaska Boundary Tribunal. Most of the Correspondence with Joseph Pope, Under - Secretary of State and Deputy Registrar - General; F .C .Wade, Counsel to the Canadian Government; and Edward Blake, the leading British Agent to the Tribunal. Because of illness, Blake was later replaced by Sifton. Other correspondents include Sir Wilfrid Laurier, Prime Minister of Canada; Sir Charles Fitzpatrick, Minister of Justice; Morley Wickett, professor at the University of Toronto; Joseph Choate, the United States Ambassador to the United Kingdom; the Marquess of Lansdowne, Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs; Baron Alverstone, Lord Chief Justice of England; John Foster, United States Agent to the Tribunal; Sir Louis Jette, British Agent before the Tribunal; Justice Armour, Before the Tribunal; and F. H. Villiers, Under - Secretary of State, Foreign Office. 4 files
